Concord.Rancho Ca\u00f1ada del Hambre y Las Bols:
Rancho Cañada del Hambre y Las Bolsas was a 13,354-acre (54.04 km2) Mexican land grant in present day northwestern Contra Costa County, California.
It was given in 1842 by Governor Juan Alvarado to Teodora Soto. The grant consisted of "Cañada del Hambre" which means "Valley of Hunger" in Spanish, and "Las Bolsas del Hambre" which refers to "pockets" of land.
